item.title: #4 - Git Tutorial / Commands
item.description: Git is a program used for version control through github.com. So here are the steps I use to create a repository: git init echo "# <Repo Name>" >> README.md git add README.md git commit -m "1st Commit" Now I go to my github account page and hit “New Repository”, then type in a name and hit create. Back to the terminal: git remote add origin <url to .git> git push -u origin master git add * git commit -m “<message>” git push To save myself some time, I added the following line to my .
